meanings.definition: In a deaf manner; without the ability to hear.
meanings.sent1: She moved deafly through the room, unaware of the loud music playing.
meanings.sent2: The old man walked deafly, unable to hear the birds chirping around him.
meanings.sent3: The cat slept so deeply, it snored deafly through the night.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood deafly in the forest, oblivious to the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The silence enveloped the room, settling deafly over everything.

meanings.definition: In a skillful or adept manner.
meanings.sent1: He played the piano deafly, hitting each note with precision.
meanings.sent2: The chef chopped vegetables deafly, showcasing his culinary expertise.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks so deafly that no one could figure them out.
meanings.sent4: The athlete moved deafly on the field, outmaneuvering all opponents.
meanings.sent5: Her fingers moved deafly across the guitar strings, producing beautiful music.
